intro: Xeropetalum minus, commonly known as the lesser xeropetalum, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. It is a herbaceous plant that typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, exhibiting xerophytic adaptations such as reduced leaf surface area. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, a common feature among members of its family. It is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in regions with limited water availability. Due to its unique morphology and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptations to drought conditions.
